item.title: Python Internals â€“ CPython Bytecode
item.description: In this post, I am gonna walk you through compiling python code to CPython bytecode, what code objects are, how to construct them, how to disassemble them, and how to decompile them. I will be using CPython 3.6.5. A simple example >>> codestr = """print('Witness me!')""" >>> compiled_codestr = compile(codestr, '<string>', 'exec') >>> type(compiled_codestr) <class 'code'> Whoo, we have created our first code object. We passed arguments to the compile function as follows:
